104.name: CAT Live | Deep Learning and Neural Nets

story: ‎أحمد عاكف‎ shared CAT Reloaded's event to the group: Egyptian Geeks.

34.name: CAT Live | Deep Learning and Neural Nets

name: CAT Live | Deep Learning and Neural Nets
caption: CAT Live | Deep Learning and Neural Nets
description:
48% of Google products has deep learning capabilities as Google Now, Voice Search, Google Photos automatic tags and many other real life applications. Neural Networks were invented in early 1950’s as a mathematical model of brain neurons. They have been used in many applications as image recognition, natural language processing, face detection, image captioning, and even recently learning algorithms. Many academic institutions, large corporations, and startups work in deep learning and hiring researchers, software engineers, and data scientist. In this session, you will learn about neural networks basics and how to start out in this field.
————————————————————————————
Prerequisites: 
Some machine learning will be helpful.
Know what are matrices.
Vectors and how to multiply them.
Some programming experience.
————————————————————————————
Date:
Friday,  September 23, 2016 – 9:00 PM
————————————————————————————
Duration: 
1 hour and 30 mins
————————————————————————————
Bio:
Hazem Nomer is a Master student at Faculty of Science, Alexandria University doing research in deep learning and neural networks. Since my senior year, I have used recurrent nets and lstms (special types of neural networks) in forecasting stock returns, adaptive user interfaces, news headlines generation and recommendation.
————————————————————————————
